New Directions

                    
                    in the Study of the Mind                 
            
        
    
    

New Directions in the Study of the Mind is a new research project at the Faculty of Philosophy in Cambridge, supported by the John Templeton Foundation. The aim of this project is to investigate questions about intentionality and consciousness from a non-physicalist, non-reductive perspective. More details about the intellectual and historical background, as well as the research questions of the project, may be found here.

The project will last for two years, from July 2015 to July 2017. There will be a weekly seminar in Cambridge running for two academic years, a number of workshops, and a major conference, among other activities.

In addition, there will be two rounds of calls for proposals for smaller initiatives to be funded by the project. Details about funded initiatives can be found here. Instructions on how to submit a proposal in the second round will be announced in Spring 2016.
